com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.ui
Class DataSourceView

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.ui.DataSourceView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Positionable
public abstract class DataSourceView
extends java.lang.Object
implements Positionable

Definition of a subtab representing a concrete view of a DataSource in DataSource Window.

Author:
Jiri Sedlacek

Constructor Detail

DataSourceView

public DataSourceView(DataSource dataSource,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.awt.Image icon,
                      int preferredPosition,
                      boolean isClosable)
Creates new DataSourceView. Order of the notifications/queries is as follows: willBeAdded() -> getView() -> added() -> removed()

Parameters:
dataSource - dataSource of the view
name - name of the view as it appears in the subtab,
icon - icon of the view as it appears in the subtab,
preferredPosition - preferred position of the view among all other views for the DataSource,
isClosable - true if the user is allowed to close the view, false otherwise.

setAlert

protected void setAlert(DataSourceView.Alert newAlert,
                        java.lang.String newText)

willBeAdded

protected void willBeAdded()
Notification when the view is about to be added to DataSourceWindow. This notification comes from a thread other than EDT and its main intention is to provide a possibility to do some models inits before the actual UI is displayed. This call is blocking (blocks opening the view, progress bar is shown) but long-running initializations should still use separate thread and update the UI after the models are ready.

added

protected void added()
Notification when the view has been added to DataSourceWindow. This notification comes from a thread other than EDT.

removed

protected void removed()
Notification when the view has been either programatically removed from tabbed pane or closed by the user by clicking the X. This notification comes from a thread other than EDT
